content:
Normally, Thunderbird would prompt if server is refusing due to incorrect password. All I can think of would be to either manually add the password to Thunderbird, or to remove what is there to allow a prompt. Here goes: - click settings>privacy&security - click saved passwords and then show passwords - highlight the incoming server row and rightclick and select 'edit password'

OR... - from same place, highlight the incoming and outgoing rows and delete.
creator: davidsk

content: when I deleted a folder, it appears as a sub folder of trash. Are you saying it is not there to simply move back where you want it?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: You could notify your email provider of the issue. This might also be the sender's problem if these error occur when sending to a large list of recipients.
creator: davidsk

content: David - thanks for your thoughts, but when I contacted Talktalk, they suggested I contact Thunderbird. The sender was sending only to me.
creator: colin.jannaway

content: That is an example of the level of support some email providers give. No email client could ever give that error message. The message is being generated by a TalkTalk server. I did a quick web search on this error message and noticed there are others out there who report to their email provider and are ignored. In this case, Thunderbird isn't even involved. Message goes from the sender's email server to the TalkTalk server which responds back. They are ignoring the problem.
creator: davidsk

content: Unless any other suggestions are received, perhaps I need to go back to Talktalk, and hopefully get a different "adviser".
creator: colin.jannaway

content: Yes, if there is web access to the message, tell them it's not coming there. Don't even mention Thunderbird.
creator: davidsk

content: If you are receiving error messages, those may prove helpful.
creator: davidsk

content: Please provide full text of email error message.
creator: davidsk

content: We only provide support here on the forum. Please describe your problem and someone here will attempt to assist. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Be sure you have Thunderbird set to allow cookies at settings>privacy&security when attempting to set up account, omit the password. That often works.
creator: davidsk
